Post_Title: ‚ÄúWhen a person tells you you hurt them, you don‚Äôt get to decide you didn‚Äôt‚Äù.
post_text: I found this amazing quote and fits perfectly with my narcissitic parents.

Threads.Reply_Text:
Truth!

If I tell my nMom that she hurt me, she informs me that 1. No she didn‚Äôt, and 2. In reality, I am the one that hurt her

Replies.Reply_Text:
This.
Or, my personal favorite, "you hurt yourself by misunderstanding me, if you were a better daughter this wouldn't happen"
Or its, "well that's the way your percieved my words" and thinks thats an apology
wow its like our moms share a brain
Lol I feel like all narcs are psychic with one another
It drains so much energy that I don't even have anymore

I'm sorry it's getting too much for you. Especially with no escape with the worlds problem. Just try to limit your contact with her as much as possible and remind yourself whatever she says is simply just manipulation
Thanks for saying that. It's nice to have a reminder that I'm not crazy and that I'm not a bad person for wanting to limit contact in the future. The guilt is real.

Its definitely a big hump to get over and the healing process hurts like hell but overall your days will start to feel normal for once. No more walking on egg shells the entire time. The guilt is real but never forget, never sacrifice your mental health. Even if it's for your own blood
I feel this. Thanks bud. I needed that
I had to go full on no contact with mine. It hurts knowing she could/would never be the mom I needed her to be, but I'm a lot better off without her in my life.
Hard same. I couldn‚Äôt take one more ‚Äúwell I‚Äôm sorry you feel that way‚Äù. Never just ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry‚Äù.
Mad respect for you bud. Hopefully I'll have something similar in my life.
They share a tush
Loving that username
Thanks üòÉ

Or ‚Äúthat‚Äôs your judgment call‚Äù

I‚Äôd like to punch her in the nose and when she‚Äôs bleeding profusely- tell her that her nose hurting is her judgment call; I just think that she‚Äôs being sensitive.

üò≥üò≥üò≥üò≥üò≥
This is.... Wow.

This quote backfires here though.
My nmom usually claims I hurt her to create drama and ratify her attacking "back"
Cmon mom, no way you are hurt because i said my birthday makes me depressed.

See and this is where I worry I‚Äôm an a**hole because if my child said their birthday depresses them I would have some hurt, but I would respond differently then your mom so maybe I‚Äôm just not too great and not too bad?

I feel that. In working with my therapist (on dealing with my N/BPD/cluster B parent), I've come to realize that the difference is not whether or not you have the feelings, but how you deal with them. Feeling hurt is natural and normal and human and healthy. Weaponizing that hurt against someone you "love" is not. So... you're not the a**hole. Hope this helps.

Yes when my daughter says something that makes me feel hurt, I deal with the pain with a friend or someone my age separately. I then sympathize with her feelings because I‚Äôm her mom. I‚Äôm not supposed to be retaliating or taking her personally.
It‚Äôs fine to feel hurt. It‚Äôs your actions that matter.

There‚Äôs nothing wrong with being disappointed or hurt by something. It‚Äôs completely the reaction. A normal parent would say something like ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry to hear that, is there anything I can do to make it better?‚Äù instead of ‚Äúyou have hurt me by saying you are depressed‚Äù

Ahhhh and this normal reaction wasn‚Äôt modeled to me so while I always knew better I often don‚Äôt know how to react instead so there‚Äôs been a lot of silence on my part. I liked hearing your response.

It certainly wasn‚Äôt modeled for me growing up either!

Advise that I‚Äôm trying to follow from my therapist, that may help you as well:  as someone raised by a narcissist, you may feel responsible for things that are not your responsibility.  We are all responsible for our own emotions. (Yes, people can hurt us, but I‚Äôm thinking about ‚Äúnormal‚Äù situations). If a child is depressed about their birthday, it could be about something that you have no power over.  You cannot ‚Äúmake‚Äù someone happy. You can just act with empathy, and not make it about your own needs (the way your parents probably did). It‚Äôs so important to break the cycle!

I was just coming here to say something similar. If a child is depressed a healthy person will respond to the situation by centering what the child needs. Yes, it may hurt you to hear that your child is hurting but you treat your pain as secondary so you can prioritize helping your child.

If you're a narc, on the other hand, then you find a way to make it all about you no matter what's happening with your child. Their emotions and needs are an inconvenience not important enough to be discussed, let alone require support that takes the attention off of you where it belongs.

Yes which is why I worry because it can be/sometimes is my initial reaction. I have to remember that‚Äôs not me that‚Äôs my grandma and even that doesn‚Äôt have to invalidate my feelings. It‚Äôs (maybe just for me) really about slowing down and choosing your response as opposed to feeling like your knee-jerk reaction must be shared.
Well said!
Why would that hurt YOU? I could see feeling sad, or sympathetic, or empathetic. But hurt? Why?

Because if they hate their birthday I must have done something wrong to not make their life at least likeable. At that point bc this is future tense for me, i would think of everything i tried to do to make their life good and wonder what more i should have done. When I say hurt I mean like in a sad way, I might not be using the most accurate word?
It's the wrong word.

I‚Äôm trying to really put myself there and I do think there would be a hurt feeling. I‚Äôm sorry this upsets you. Maybe you expect my ‚Äúhurt‚Äù to come from a place of meanness and not genuine sadness? Either way I recognize not to put that on the child, I was explaining I felt like a bad person for even feeling the feeling where now I see it‚Äôs the reaction not the feeling that I should worry more about. I really hope this rant makes sense, you seemed to be really taken aback by my feelings. Oh also I wanted to ask what word you would use?
Sad. Hurt implies that someone is hurting you, but it's not about you, it's about them. They can feel any way they want to feel.

not necessarily tho.. u can be hurt by plans falling through, you can be hurt by someone forgetting your birthday, you can be hurt by not getting through an audition, you can be hurt by various circumstances where no one is 'hurting you' per se... imo at least

I never said they had to feel a different way, only that them feeling that way would make me feel some hurt (probably a few emotions tbh) but I know I can‚Äôt make a person stop feeling their feelings nor would I want to make them...

FWIW, I think you're being clear, and "hurt" is a perfectly appropriate word to use. Like "it would hurt if I slammed my thumb in the oven door" and "it would hurt if my child told me they were unhappy." It would cause me pain, therefore it would hurt. It doesn't mean culpability.

Why would ur depression hurt her? Rather a mother would be concerned and try to help out..BUT the N has to use that also to talk about herself and completely invalidate your feelings..terrible...hope u are able to get out of there for always

I told my mum didn‚Äôt want anything from her this Christmas because there‚Äôs too much drama when things go wrong (wrong size, faulty, etc). I explained it was a defensive move to protect me. But apparently I‚Äôm doing this to punish her and ‚Äústop her having that pleasure‚Äù of giving good gifts to us. It‚Äôs apparently me out to get her, not me trying to avoid more hurt and drama. I don‚Äôt know if she‚Äôs a narc but she shows some scary signs she might be and I don‚Äôt know that she knows it.

She asked what my husband would like one Christmas and never takes his Amazon list suggestion (he doesn‚Äôt expect people to buy from it, it‚Äôs just a ‚Äúif you‚Äôre stuck, I‚Äôd like anything from here‚Äù and it‚Äôs got a range of low to higher priced items on it) and to be fair she did a good job that year for him with my help, though she‚Äôs gotten him some questionable things in the past (and one even seemed like a dig).

For me she never seems to ask what I might like and just gets me shoes or clothes and I‚Äôm quite particular with those and like some input.

But it‚Äôs not even about what she gets us. I‚Äôm not that fussy. It‚Äôs about what happens afterwards and how she doesn‚Äôt seem to put much thought into it where I‚Äôm concerned. She just assumed I‚Äôll like something. To be fair, I‚Äôve never rejected what she‚Äôs given me, and sometimes I even like it, I only mention if it‚Äôs clearly faulty and even then I‚Äôll do it with grace and tact. But if they get a whiff I might not like something, it‚Äôs mentioned...and I‚Äôm made out to be ungrateful somehow. I‚Äôm too afraid to tell them if I don‚Äôt like something because I don‚Äôt want to hurt them, especially her. Mostly out of compassion as I never wanted her to feel bad, but I think partially out of fear. I just quietly get rid of it these days. Easier now that I don‚Äôt live there.

Edit: Sorry, kind of went on a tangent there. It‚Äôs just the recent argument has been going a while and it stemmed from something I said about a gift that she (finally, months after it) got for my birthday. She‚Äôs making out she‚Äôs super sad and hurt about it and I‚Äôm saying this isn‚Äôt the main issue if *that* caused this months long argument, especially as I‚Äôve since apologised for what was said (even though it was fairly innocuous).

I get this. Same with mine. She doesn‚Äôt care if YOU enjoy/want the presents, she wants to enjoy giving you the presents. My nMom still gives me presents that would be appropriate for an 8 year old (I‚Äôm in my 30s and do not have children) and gets ‚Äúhurt‚Äù if I don‚Äôt pretend I am thrilled (not even just moderately like) with them.

I tried having a convo with her about the age appropriateness of her purchases several times. Apparently I‚Äôm ‚Äúungrateful‚Äù. She also was not interested in the Amazon wishlist.  I should mention it‚Äôs not about money, she spends a lot on these things. I‚Äôd be thrilled if she gave me a check or gift card for half of what she spent on this stuff.

Even presents for you are about her, not you.

Oh, she did something like that to my husband once. We were both weirded out by it and this is the time I said it felt like a dig at him.

He likes to doodle. Draw. Write. He‚Äôll do it when we‚Äôre out in a casual setting and has done it when we‚Äôve been over at my parents house. They question me on why I don‚Äôt seem to mind it when I used to mind my sister doing it (she has aspergers, my husband doesn‚Äôt). I just told them I‚Äôve come to accept it about both of them. Plus I‚Äôve grown up since then. And my husband will put it away if you ask him to. They seemed to take offence that he‚Äôd do it at their house, when nobody was talking to him so what was he gonna do? He‚Äôs a quiet man and he‚Äôs never felt comfortable at their house - for reasons I now see. So one birthday they got him a small wooden box. Kinda nice. Not ornate and kinda cheap, but the cost of things don‚Äôt really come into it for us. Inside it was full of Marvel universe things. We both like Marvel, but I‚Äôm talking a kids colouring book, colouring pencils, erasers, pencils, etc. And a pinky/purple notebook (that sort of A/B foil that changes colour in the light when it moves) that looked more girly than anything. He was like...eeeehhhh....thanks!

Much later I asked them about it. They said it was a joke, and the main present was the box. I still don‚Äôt accept that it wasn‚Äôt a dig. As my counsellor has told me recently, ‚Äúit‚Äôs only a joke if everybody is in on it and finds it funny‚Äù.

Unbiased stranger vote: 100% a dig

That is so weird. Completely agree with your therapist‚Äôs definition of a ‚Äújoke‚Äù

Totally get this. Every birthday, every Christmas, my mother will ask me what I would like- she asks lots of detailed questions like what colour/ size/ style/ where to buy it etc. In my entire life she has bought the thing we discussed once.

When I was a kid she would typically buy me a cheap knock-off version of whatever I had asked for (a generic fashion doll instead of a Barbie, market stall trainers instead of brand name ones, a blue summer dress if I asked for a black Goth dress)- it wasn't about money because she would buy a load of tat to go with the gift, so the whole pile cost more than the one thing I actually wanted. One Christmas I tried to explain that although it was kind of her to spend ¬£80 on a necklace with a verse about mothers and daughters engraved on it, it just wasn't my style and I would have preferred the ¬£25 earrings she'd asked for the details of. She. Went. Ballistic. I was ungrateful, I was cruel, I didn't deserve her thoughtfulness and consideration...

In recent years she will give me boxes of gifts (lots of little bits and pieces)- most of them are pre-loved and sometimes well used... she's given me chocolates with bites taken out, wrapped up as a gift. Body cream with half of it used. A slightly burnt candle.

Keeps me in my place, eh? üòè

Oh, I know that feeling. Like, I‚Äôd rather have one nice thing that doesn‚Äôt have to cost the earth or anything, but is something I would like that isn‚Äôt loads of tat.

I‚Äôm a photographer. They once got me a ‚Äústrobe‚Äù that was basically a cheap (like sub ¬£5) light that would flash. It had no practical use for stills photography. I‚Äôm still not sure what you‚Äôd use it for! I had flashes. I tried to see it as them trying to be thoughtful and considerate but ending up way off the mark but they didn‚Äôt even ask about that sort of thing. Plus I didn‚Äôt expect them to get me gear anyway as it‚Äôs expensive (for the real thing, anyway!).

I never used it and eventually years later it got decluttered and donated to a charity shop. I‚Äôve had so much tat over the years. I‚Äôve had some nice things too, like video games and once we got a Wii, but I stopped playing console games eventually because I was made to feel bad about playing them during the day (lazy) and I couldn‚Äôt play them in the living room at night since they‚Äôd be watching TV. They did set up a room to play games in but it was uncomfortable, the chair was lumpy and the room smelled of the dogs since it was their ‚Äúbedroom‚Äù lol.

That‚Äôs awful about the chocolates though, not had anything that bad at least. I don‚Äôt mind getting second hand so long as it‚Äôs in good condition. And not food!
Wow. She sounds horrible. My condolences
Thank you. She is more passive aggressive than outright nasty- if you met either of my parents briefly you'd probably come away thinking what nice, jolly people they are. And they are- for a while.
My mother is similar in that respect.  She puts on a good show for ‚Äúoutsiders‚Äù.  But yours takes the ribbon for passive aggressive behavior!

shes being manipulative, trust.
you have gone out of your way to be polite and gracious, but notice how she still finds a way to make the situation into somehow YOU'RE being insensitive to HER feelings? if she cared at all about giving good gifts to you, she would at least ask what you wanted or for a list, and 100% would be APOLOGETIC AND EMBARRASSED  rather than pissed off and blaming you for it if something was faulty or didnt fit. if she was genuine, and got the sense you didnt like something she got you, she would maybe try to get info from you about specifically why and what kind of things youd prefer so she could do better next time. her actions betray that she couldnt give a rats ass about making you happy or giving you anything you enjoy, she cares about, in no particular order - the drama, control, feeling like SHE is so thoughtful and generous, you feeling grateful/indebted to her, and opportunity to paint you as ungrateful and rude. when you react like you do, she doesnt get any of those things so she ramps up the tactics. i hope this explanation brings you some relief that you have done nothing wrong ‚ô°

Well to be fair she was right that I asked about something in the book she got me before I ever said thanks for it. I apologised for that. It was an aromatherapy book that‚Äôs actually quite nice. But there was something about ‚Äúsmudging‚Äù in it that I found odd as as far as I‚Äôm aware it relates to new age/Wicca practices so it made me a little uncomfortable (I‚Äôm a Christian) but only as a point of ‚Äúoh, turn to page xyz, it says bla bla bla and I thought that related to Wicca etc. Bit odd‚Äù I was looking for reassurance from my mother, an older Christian, I guess? I could have worded it better really. She got the same book at the same time.

Anyway, she got down about it. She said she didn‚Äôt know it was in there as if I implied she did (I didn‚Äôt) and then got all surly later but pretended nothing was wrong right up until I accepted that maybe she *was* ok and I was reading too much into what she was saying on messenger. Then she said ‚Äúhave you ever considered not being so negative?‚Äù

I wasn‚Äôt being, I was a bit uncertain if anything, not sure what to make of it, but she makes out I was looking for something bad to say about it when in reality I was just absent mindedly flicking through it. I said it was ok, I didn‚Äôt need to pay attention to that bit if I didn‚Äôt like it and I left it there, but that wasn‚Äôt enough. Kept telling me to send the book back to Amazon if I didn‚Äôt want it even after I‚Äôd said it was fine. I hadn‚Äôt said thank you for the gift yet though, and I think it was partially because we were already on thin ice from a previous argument of her nagging me to read health things even after her saying it was up to me if I read them or not. Plus I was ill. And kind of annoyed it was now March/April and my birthday was 3-4 months ago. And various other things. She much much later (as in a couple of weeks ago while we were still discussing it all) brought up the gifts that failed for Christmas and my birthday - shoes. One pair was too big even with thick socks and the others were faulty (and ugly as heck so I‚Äôm so glad they were faulty, but she doesn‚Äôt know I think that). She said she thought she‚Äôd finally got me something I liked with the book but even that ‚Äúwasn‚Äôt up to scratch‚Äù and she‚Äôd never mentioned the shoes before. She said she was only bringing it up to give context to how she finally felt about the book (reasonable for most people I guess) but the hidden subtext seems to be it‚Äôs my fault the shoes didn‚Äôt work out or that I rejected them somehow when I didn‚Äôt, especially as she‚Äôs never brought them up before. She got me to try the ugly shoes on to see if they fit and it was obvious they were faulty. But yeah, to hear her say ‚Äúyou‚Äôre punishing me for something and taking away the pleasure I get from giving gifts‚Äù was like wow, really? You‚Äôre making this about YOU? I even said as much but she had no real answer. It felt like a mask slipping moment. It‚Äôs never been about trying to get back at her. I just want it all to be normal.
I get it. Christmas makes me feel seasick. I hate it because of all the Drama of gifts.

My mom never fails to get clothes the wrong size when giving a gift, usually too large. Unless it's underwear, then it's too small.

She was so mad when my cup size at 16 was bigger than hers at the same age, she kept telling me that my tits popping out of my bra was normal to avoid buying me the right size smh

I was shocked when I learned this term. It wss exactly the formula theyd use down to the letter.

Removed. Please do not bring politics into this.

My mother's personal process is as follows;

No I'd didnt

Ok maybe I did but it wasnt on purpose and your blaming me hurts me.

Ok maybe It wasnt but it's your fault and your blaming me hurts me.

It's your fault AND you hurt me

You hurt me.

The narcissist's prayer.

That didn‚Äôt happen.
And if it did, it wasn‚Äôt that bad.
And if it was, that‚Äôs not a big deal.
And if it is, it is not my fault.
And if it was, I didn‚Äôt mean it.
And if I did. You deserved it.
I do enjoy that poem. It's darkly validating.

If you want a good poem (not narc related, but darkly funny), this is "Resum√©" by Dorothy Parker.

Razors pain you
Rivers are damp
Acid stains you
And drugs cause cramp
Guns are unlawful
Nooses give
Gas smells awful
You might as well live

It makes me laugh every time I recite it.
A good argument
I remember this from Girl Intereupted, love that poem
I used to have this up on my cube wall in a terrible job I had straight out of college.

This!  And then I get the added, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry that you CHOOSE to feel that way‚Äù.

I sometimes wonder if my blood pressure will rocket up so fast I will zoom off the earth. ;)
Oh yay the good ol' passive agressive nonappology.
I just experienced this the other day.  The rage is slammed into me if I dare express I was hurt about something.

Or, 'I deserved it'.

Blaming the victim:

"Look at what you made me do."

Narcissists Prayer comes to mind.

Omg, she said I learned to trick her and bargain with her. I asked her where I learned to bargain at a young age..... Maybe bc she would ground me for a YEAR! Then make deals with me to let me off a month early....

But it‚Äôs always my fault, and the most recent attack... Why can‚Äôt you get your life together?

Oh! The grounding for crazy amounts of time!

I once got grounded for a month as a teen because we were singing a song in church and I sang the correct words, (as written and in full view of both of us). She was singing the wrong words, and apparently my singing the correct words was ‚Äúpurposefully trying to make her feel stupid‚Äù.  This wasn‚Äôt a performance or anything, we were standing in a pew.  She refused to look at the words because she felt that singing with her eyes closed was more holy.
Gaslighting at it's finest s/
Just reading this pisses me off. I've been NC for over a year now but just thinking about my nmother's inability to understand ANYTHING outside of her bullshit bubble is just infuriating.
I have whiplash this is so relatable. Both my parents and my nsis use this.
Or they minimize it. Call you soft. Etc.

Oh sheeeet.

'Yeah I heard you say that you're feeling mad but I feel more mad because...'

'Why should I have to accomodate your needs while you do....'
Is your mom my mom?
Haha
Exactly
Lol
I get that first, and then, "You probably deserved it anyway."
Yes, exactly mine too.

I know the feeling. "Its never them, they didnt do anything wrong. Look at what you are doing."
Im sorry you deal with that. Your feelings matter.
Really Nxgga
